DDECROLY is a VET institution located in Santander. It is looking for the continuous improvement of the quality through the internationalization: management and organization, competencies of the staff, linguistic skills,  curriculum development , European dimension . We also focus on preparing good professionals providing the necessary skills to our learners for the transition to the labour market.
For that reason, we take advantage from the European Commission tools throught the programmes they offer such as Erasmus+.
We propose to develop a project of four VET Learners' mobility  traineeship (work placement) from Technician in Administrative Management and Technician in Microcomputer Systems and Networks  studies. They will carry out the traineeship in a real workplacement, as it is the 
 Administrative and Computer Departments  respectively, in Southern Regional College in Northern Ireland during 14 days. In those departments they will make all the specific professional tasks which are carrying out in the  Administrative and ICT departments. 
So, the learner will improve the level of key competences and skills, with particular regard to their relevance for the labour market and their contribution to a cohesive society,will get competences linked to their professional profiles, will improve a foreign language and will enhance employability and improve the career prospects. This mobility period will be part of the FCT subject which the learner has to take to get the certificate.
We pretend to develop a project of four mobilities for training periods- job shadowing-during three days. Two mobilities will take place in Panevezys College (Lituania) and two in Southern Regional College (Norte de Irlanda). They will carry out in the International Departments of the both institutions, with the objective of observing the methods in the management of the internship in both countries.
Thanks to this mobilities we will get the following results:
-Through strengthened cooperation between the world of education and training and the world of work, we will  help the learners to incorporate to an european labour market 
- We will improve the quality of VET studies for the students and for the companies
- We will bring the education closer to the companies in the eruopean area and we will know different professional profiles demanding in the labour market
-We will foster quality improvements, innovation excellence and internationalisation at the level of education and training institutions, in particular through enhanced transnational cooperation between education and training providers and other stakeholders
-We will contibute to prepare students as a qualify professionals , open-minded and with a big and varied experience
-We will promote the languages and culture of other countries from the European Union, so as the integration of different cultures 
The project is held in three phases: phase of preparation, phase of implementation and phase of projection.
The phase of preparation: will include information, application and objective selection of the candidates using  criteria of equality and transparency, activities of approach to the culture of them different countries and the logistics.
Execution phase where students and teachers begin their mobility period 
Projection phase: this project will reach a repercussion and impact on our students, educational community in general and in our institution  in particular
For our institution: international level: improved management skills and internationalisation strategies; reinforced cooperation with partners from other countries;more modern, dynamic, committed and professional environment inside the organisationready to integrate good practices and new methods into daily activities; open to synergies with organisations active in different social, educational and employment fields; planning strategically the professional development of their staff in relation to individual needs and organisational objectives
For students: First contact with an european labour market providing n added value to his/her CV  and enhance employability and improve career prospects; improve foreign language competences, increase sense of initiative and entrepreneurship; enhance intercultural awareness; more active participation in society; better awareness of the European project and the EU values;
increase motivation for working abroad after the mobility period
For teachers: improve competences, linked to their professional profiles; increase capacity to trigger changes in terms of modernisation and international, increase motivation and satisfaction in their daily work; increase opportunities for professional and career development 
To long term all those benefits will contribute to create a modern international and high quality institution , offer more quality in the activities of teaching and learningthere will be a greater understanding and response to the social diversity, linguistic and cult
Showing our Competences and Knowledge:  SHOCK

DECROLY  is  trying to inspire the European consciousness of our students, promoting  their training and opening their labour expectations, taking advantage of the European Community  tools, such as the Erasmus+ program that propose a mobility project for students and teachers.
Our project outlines six mobilities. Four for learners from "Gestion Administrativa" and  "Sistemas Microinformáticos y Redes" for traineeship in companies in Ireland and Lithuanian respectively for 14 days. And two mobilities for staff training in the form of a a job shadowing/observation in Lithuania during three days.
The project will have three phases:
1.- Preparation phase
2.- Execution phase
3.- Impact phase
The preparation phase contains : information, application and the objective selection of the candidates , taking into account the principles of Iguality and transparency criteria. As well , in this phase it is taking place the cultural and linguistic preparation of the countries the learners are staying in . The logistic of the project is taking place in this phase too.
The Execution phase is the period of the mobility for the learners and the staff.
The Impact phase is the benefit of this project in  our educative community which we pretend to be : closer and open mind to Europe. With a correct academic training and a correct linguistic competences, we avoid barriers to work abroad , we will improve our international cooperation with companies  and institutions. We will get more professional opportunities.
Through this project, the lingüístic competences will improve considerably ( we are a bilingual school and this is a key important point in our institution), it will adquire new competences in knowledge , proffesional capacities and abilities and skills to adapt a new environment  cultural and proffesional. This will impact in our institution  turning into a reference school as innovative and 
advance in new technologies and with internalisation character

Project Title : "What's APPening around our Europe"The project evolved as as a result of involvement in  previous Comenius projects, influenced by partners attending the Bett ICT Fair and driven by the key  priorities  from each Schools Development Plan.The main objectives of the project is ICT focused with the  acquisition of digital competences  for staff and pupils through learning how to use 6 "content free"  iPad App's whilst investigating and learning about the culture, language , community and schools of our partners. A secondary objective will be the learning of a second language  as the App's used, activities and methodology employed throughout  the project wholly support this.The project will last 36 months and there will 6 Transnational meetings with a focus on planning, preparation,evaluation  and report writing  interspersed with 6 joint staff training events. The focus at these events will be the host partner to facilitate the training for the staff required to understand how to use each of the App's.  Small groups of children will also have the opportunity to travel and visit some of the partner schools. The App's and associated activities  that will follow in the host schools are as follows:(1) iMovie - production of short movie describing each partners school and  community(2) Edmodo - set up and prepare teaching lessons to be uploaded onto Edmodo to help teach partners a second language(3) Explain Everything - children will use this to produce a multimedia presentation of a "Diary of a School Year"(4) Number- schools will investigate, collect, interpret, compare, contrast and present a range of universal data available in  each partners community(5) Garage Band - pupils will learn to record, compose and play a variety of traditional tunes and songs using local instruments . There will also be opportunities to collaborate and play together,(6)Bookcreator- children will learn to produce multi media stories which will encourage learning of second language (eg text in home language and spoken in English.A record of all activities, reports , etc will be uploaded onto our projects Twinspace platform. This solution is safe and will allow us to communicate, collaborate, exhibit, exchange and evaluate throughout the duration of our project.The partners are six European countries some of which have previously worked together on past projects who include N Ireland (UK), Slovenia, Croatia, Czech Republic, Italy and Finland. Their children are aged   from 4-14 and in this child centred project they  will play a key role from the beginning through to the  to the end  with them being involved  at all stages including planning, upskilling, evaluating and contributing to final report.The key result will be the up skilling of teachers/pupils in the digital  competences investigated. These skills will be a legacy as they are transferable to different contexts and the teachers will use these with future generations of children. The activities and products complete will be uploaded onto Twinspace and can be viewed by all stakeholders. In concluding, as a result of this project it is envisaged that  the knowledge, skills, competencies and second language acquisition that the staff and children have gained will enable them to feel confident - to study, travel and work throughout our modern ever evolving Europe.

The number of students at Polje Primary School has grown significantly in the recent years. Many of them come from families with low socio-economic status or from a different language background. Their environment does not encourage them to develop their own potentials and does not enable successful integration into school and society. The main goal of the project ‘I Can Do It, Too’ is to find both new ways of creating a stimulative school environment that could integrate all students and new methods of scaffolding students with difficulties in developing literacy, numeracy and ICT skills as well as their general language skills. Even though our students come from various cultural backgrounds, we keep noticing that they are not really aware of the richness brought by cultural diversity. Teaching professionals would therefore like to show them the benefits of the European dimension using our own experience, and encourage them to be open and tolerant and to share their own cultural experiences with others.
That is why thirteen teaching professionals from different fields (class teachers, a Slovene teacher, a Maths and Craft teacher, English teachers, special needs teachers) shall take part in twelve different activities in the form of structured courses or job shadowing. The themes of chosen activities are connected with developing literacy and numeracy, also through discovering cultural heritage and incorporating activities outdoors, with the integration of socially underprivileged students and ways of supporting their parents, and with incorporating creative teaching methods into lessons.
Participants in the project shall form smaller teams. Within these teams they shall develop new programmes and activities, aimed at long-lasting achievement of our goals: a programme for developing pre-literacy skills through sensorimotor training; a programme of workshops for literacy strengthening (for students with below-average results on reading tests); extra-curricular activities for the motivation for reading; reading tea-parties for students and parents; a programme for scaffolding immigrant students and their parents; the incorporation of ICT and new teaching methods in maths and foreign language lessons. Activities shall be developed in such a way to enable the achievement of goals throughout the whole primary school, from grade 1 to grade 9.
Výukou, kurzy a stínováním v evropských školách k lepšímu učení v ZŠ Kunovice, U Pálenice

The project originated  on the basis of long term tendency of the pedagogical team of  the Kunovice U Pálenice school to teach in accordance with modern tendencies.  It established in accordance  with the necessity  of reaction to the changing role of a teacher, of  his new tasks.  The Kunovice U Pálenice pedagogical team is closely watching these tendencies in domestic education, in many cases even the trendsetter. But our teachers did not have a good overview of similar tendencies abroad. Program Erasmus plus, in particular activity KA1, mobility of learners and staff, has offered them ideal opportunity for a change.



 The targets of this project are as followed :



– To improve competencies of school management. Therefore we have focused our attention to schools from such countries, which are in the long term on the top of the European education in international inquiries of comparison.



– To improve competencies of school staff. Thanks to the knowledge of international schools we would like to increase competencies of other staff of the school in such way, so they would be motivated for preparation and realization of all activities , which would lead to belonging between students and the school.



– To search for new educational methods or tools. We have focused especially on using IT technologies in teaching. We are interested in such methods, which are used with the help of IT at international schools. In general we are concerned about all educational methods, which mean a move from emphasis on knowledge to emphasis on skills and knowledge application.



- To highlight European dimension of the school. We wish to work in such way so our standards are in line with other school in Europe. For our students similar projects help especially to improve knowledge about Europe, they develop sense of tolerance and variety of understanding.



– To improve language competencies of teachers and students.



– To compare different ways of working with socially disadvantaged students at Czech and international schools.



There will be 24 employees of our school involve in this project activities.

a/ School management

b/Teachers of vocational subjects

c/ Teachers of primary school

d/Caregivers of after school care

e/ School psychologist



We believe that the plan of our general activities is quite complex. We are not only looking for educational courses as the easiest way of meeting the general plan for mobilities, but we prefer cooperation between schools. We believe that after systematic search we have found partners schools which correspond with the identified needs of our organization and its other development. The project includes these activities:

Teaching assignment- two our teachers will teach at school in Ireland /physical education and chemistry/, two teachers will teach at school in Slovenia /subjects of primary school/, two teachers will teach in Italy /history, subjects of primary school/, one teacher will teach in Hungary / English language/. School management with IT teacher will shadow work of their colleagues in Finland. 

Staff training

a/Participation on courses and trainings abroad-these activities are used to improve vocational level of our teachers.

b/Job shadowing – we are going to shadow the work of our international colleagues in Finland, Ireland, Slovenia, Hungary and Italy.

During the project management we will be using standard methodological procedures. Not only for practical and logistic formalities of the projects but also for the quality and project management there will be set up a project team. 

Intended results, project affection and its long term contribution:

The prospective result of this project is fulfilment of identified needs of school. Specifically:

- Increase of management competences

- Competences of employees 

- New educational methods

- European dimension

- Language competences

- IT competences

- Education and teaching organization

- Work with disadvantaged students



Our school can get significant competitive advantage of other schools from our town thanks to this project.

Impact on our employees of school

- Improve their vocational competences

- Improve their IT competences

- Improve their language competences

- Gain excellent comparison of teaching methodology at Czech and international schools

- Improve their competences at work with disadvantaged students

- Gain partners for a discussion about educational style

- Raise their self esteem

- Raise quality of their education

- Raise their competitiveness at the job field

- Increase their position at school

Impact on students of our school

- Raise the prestige of school

- Increase the solidarity of students to school

- Improve the language ability of students

Long term contribution 

- In the final the quality of the education at school and in the town will be increased.

This project came about as a result of previous Comenius partnerships. The objectives of this project are to train staff to create, maintain and develop a Virtual Learning Environment ie a Moodle which will provide a safe, password protected environment for staff and pupils to communicate, work together and exhibit, exchange and evaluate completed work.
The curriculum focus driving the Moodle forward will be acquisition of a second language and teaching/learning of the environment and environmental issues.
The project will be child-centred right from the beginning with pupils being involved in planning the activities through the setting up of an Erasmus Plus committee in each school.
Partners come from six European countries some of whom have previously worked together on past projects who include: Ireland, Northern Ireland, Finland, Spain, Greece and Italy.
As a result of the project it is envisaged that staff and pupils will gain knowledge, skills, competencies which will enable them to travel for work and education hence Dissolving European Boundaries.
Developing Critical Thinking and Problem Solving to Raise Standards in Literacy, Numeracy and ICT.

We, St. Mary’s staff are passionate about education and our role in preparing the young people in our care for their future lives. To continually develop and enhance the educational provision provided by our school we believe that staff development is integral to the process. The funding applied for through this application would allow staff opportunities: the Senior Leadership Team the opportunity to attend courses which would strengthen the working relationships and focus members on working as a team coherently, to develop new skills in ICT, new techniques for the teaching of Literacy and Numeracy through participation in courses and the opportunity to learn about different cultures and share ideas/teaching methods with colleagues around Europe through job shadowing.
Activities planned are based around the central objective; To develop critical thinking and problem solving strategies in the 3 core curriculum areas, Literacy, Numeracy and ICT, so that all pupils can progress, raising overall standards.
Literacy: focus on Digital Literacy, requiring the development of both cognitive and technical skills, it is the ability to use information and communication to; find, evaluate, create and communicate information.
Numeracy: Developing a 3 step approach to the teaching of maths: known as CPA, the approach introduces mathematical concepts through a 3 step learning process: moving from the concrete, to pictorial and to abstract stages.
ICT: focus on coding, which teaches logic skills and problem solving preparing pupils for to succeed in an ever increasingly digital world.

Our partners are schools with whom we have long established relationships and staff will have the opportunity to visit and teach in their schools, both observing and sharing good practice. 

We have identified the following visits 
Literacy- Greece and Italy, our colleagues in these schools are dealing with large numbers of immigrants who come with little or no knowledge of the working language of their adopted countries. We have observed in our own school a drop in the level of language with which our pupils enter the school system, seeing how our colleagues work developing early language skills we believe will be of benefit.
Numeracy- Finland and Spain-We have observed how Finland uses learning styles as a basis to sort pupils into groups, with no regress to age and we feel that this approach would work with our proposed CPA approach to Maths. And both schools are working with 3rd level Institutes and we will have the opportunity to share expertise in the field of 'Action Research'.
ICT: Finland and Republic of Ireland, our colleagues in these schools use 2 different approaches to ICT provision within their schools, Finland has a designated ICT suite, something which we are in the process of developing and Republic of Ireland has a BYO device approach where pupils bring their own tablets, devices to school for use. We would like the opportunity to compare both systems and evaluate the pros and cons of each and this will ultimately influence our choice of ICT equipment to furnish the suite.

With the evolution of technology it is now possible for us to have the whole of Europe at the touch of a button in our classrooms. The possibilities are endless, blogging, webinairs, electronic lessons all things that we could only imagine 5 years ago but are now embracing as part of our normal day to day teaching. What next then? Simple a Virtual Learning Environment a VLE, a place to store, access from anywhere, and share the bank of wonderful resources we have built up and are continuing to build through co-operating in projects with our European partners.

 This dream can easily become a reality we have the enthusiasm and are ready for the challenge but we need funding to help us achieve this. Funding will allow us to access the expertise of people working in this field, this will enable us to create a tailored made resource which meets the needs of our school. We can train staff, pupils and parents in its use and maintenance and give them access and the support to develop areas within where they can have autonomy over their learning.

We will continue to work alongside our European School partners, Basque Country, (Spain), Republic of Ireland, Finland, Greece, and Italy to develop resources to share for the mutual benefit of our pupils, in languages, the environment, the people and the places in which we live. A VLE will give us the perfect safe environment to share, exhibit and exchange information and ideas.

 We will provide opportunities for our staff to travel and visit other educational settings- where they will have the opportunity to not only experience school life in another setting but also the culture and traditions of that country. They will explore similarities and differences between education systems, meet with staff and exchange ideas and solutions to the problems we all face on a day to day basis, E safety and lack of resources especially lack of playground space. 

 We will provide opportunities for staff to develop their own personal skills and competencies working alongside specialists in the field of ICT in the educational setting. Staff will have the opportunity to broaden their horizons through travel, they will experience the culture and traditions of other nationalities. They will have opportunities to learn and build upon their existing language skills. Ultimately they will have time away from school to share new experiences with other members of staff, many of whom will never have worked closely together, thus it will help to break down barriers and promote team work within our organisation.

Scoil Eoin Pól, Loch an Iúir is a small rural school in Donegal, Ireland, with a vision of creating an e-Mature school, that will use best international practice to guide its implementation

Having gained valuable insight into the European culture of ICT through blogging and web conferencing in our previous  Comenius project, we feel confident now in developing our own Virtual Learning Environment, and in progressing to the next level of e-maturity. We as a staff believe that training and job-shadowing on a European platform, will be the best motivation staff and pupils will have in implementing the new Action Plan with regards ICT in our school, and developing ICT within International work.

The objectives of our project are to:

*become an e-mature school

*developing an Virtual Learning Platform through Moodle

*recognising International and European best practice in ICT

*developing staff competencies in using ICT

*developing staff e-confidence

*Understanding and implementing e-safety in our school 

*developing and promoting the use of iPads and tablets, enabling remote access learning

*promoting 'Google Apps for Education' as a means of mass storage for pupils

* sustaining Good Digital Citizenship

The whole school staff will be involved in this project.

We are 2 full time teachers and a 2 part-time teachers on our staff. We also want to include our ancillary staff and assistants in these mobilities and training, as they will be instrumental in the implementation and success of this project.

Staff members (6 in total) have varying levels of competencies in ICT- some with basic skills and others with more advanced skills. Our aim is to make sure that no staff member will feel left behind or inadequate in their application of technology. Thus, we have chosen staff training courses of different levels of ability and challenge, to suit the needs of our staff. Combined, these courses will help diffuse the technical challenges of ICT in our school, and promote the attainment of the aims and objectives of the project.

Methodology:

We want to identify the best way that our school can set up a Virtual Learning Platform, and develop our e-maturity.

We would like to answer the following questions:

Is e-maturity within our grasp?

Will setting up a Virtual Learning Environment benefit the participation and engagement of pupils?

Will staff e-confidence help promote an e-learning culture within our school?

Are there advantages in working towards a hybrid classroom?

Can we overcome issues with e-safety?

How can International Policy and best practice help us achieve our vision?

Will ICT training enhance our teaching?

We will use a combination of qualitative and quantitative data to guide our approach.

We hope to use descriptive research methodology along with staff, pupil and parent questionnaires during the life of the project. Random sampling of teachers and pupils will be used to obtain a representative sample of attitudes towards our e-maturity project.

Once the training and job-shadowing has been completed, we expect the results to be very positive. We expect this project to have a great impact on our staff, pupils and wider school community. We hope to be a school at the fore of e-Learning in our county, and to encourage other schools to also take a leap of faith onto the path of e-maturity. As regards our school, this project will incorporate an important international element that will make our pupils and school community feel less remote and cut-off from our neighbouring counterparts. Living on the periphery of Europe has left us isolated and independent, but through this project we hope to integrate better with our European partners, through networking and face to face encounters.

Pupils will be given opportunities to learn online, on a secure platform, at their own pace. Moodle will be able to engage them for longer, and they will become active participants in their own learning. Assessment of Learning will take place, as others with vested interest in the project will help provide feedback to pupils on an ongoing basis.

The longterm benefits of this project are endless, as we could potentially work with our partners in Spain, United Kingdom and elsewhere on a Moodle collaboration, in which KA2 activities could be conducted. This Virtual Learning Platform would provide an ideal secure platform where pupils and teachers could interact before, during and after their strategic partnership mobilities, and where pupils from a small rural school in Donegal could interact with their peers across Europe, within a common learning theme.

With the evolution of technology it is now possible for us to have the whole of Europe at the touch of a button in our classrooms. The possibilities are endless, blogging, webinairs, electronic lessons all things that we could only imagine 5 years ago but are now embracing as part of our normal day to day teaching.This dream can easily become a reality but we need funding to achieve this.
Herramientas, estrategias, emociones y Europa(Tools, Strategies, Emotions and Europe)

1. Background:Since 1946 our centre has developed itself as an innovative school with a vision that enables students to meet the new challenges of a rapidly changing society like ours. On the basis of our own identity and culture, we open ourselves to the broad and comprehensive conception of Europe and the world, respecting different social and cultural realities around us. It is within this background that we intend to expand our horizons in order to have an overview of education in Europe and to give our students the opportunity to benefit from other European educational contexts, keeping their own identity at the same time.2. The objectives of the project include-To ensure staff mobility within Europe, in order to improve their skills and to guide the educational process-To develop teaching skills to articulate formal, non-formal and informal learning, internationalization and integration into the European labour market-To develop an understanding of the social, cultural and linguistic diversity-To improve language skills and the use of ICT-To increase motivation and teachers' satisfaction at work-To increase motivation and involvement of students throughout their learning process-To identify opportunities for personal and professional growth-To facilitate cooperation with partners in the educational systems within the EU in order to exchange good teaching practices, to carry out projects and international partnerships-To develop management skills in international projects-To promote the policies, practices, methodologies and knowledge about European educational systems to the school faculty3. Partners -Sollebrunns Skola, Sweden-4th Gymnasium Agias Paraskevis Attikis, Greece-Kristianslyst School, Norway-St Mary's, Ireland-Zespol School, Polonia-Matei Basarab, Romania4. Project activities- Presentation of the Erasmus + to the school faculty and selection of participants, according to the selection criteria listed previously in the project-Drawing up the partnership agreements (Rights and Obligations of each partner) between Ramon Llull school and partners -Preparation of activities by chosen teachers: language training, intercultural training and management and curricular approach in the European context-Follow up of the activities and the objectives comprised in the project carried out by the project manager and the representative of partner institutions . After internal and external evaluation, the need to incorporate any modifications in the School Plan of Ramon Llull school, will be assessed-Constant communication between the project manager, representatives of partner institutions and teachers involved in the mobilities-Promotion and dissemination of project results (the visibility of the project activities is ensured through different broadcast channels available at Ramon Llull school)-Preparation and submission of the final project report-Integration of the experience in the educational process of Ramon Llull school and preparation for new collaborations and partnerships involving European mobility.5. MethodologyAccording to our school philosophy, our methodology carried out throughout the project is based in cooperative work and team work of all the staff, with the aim to disseminate the acquired knowledge to our students and faculty members. In accordance with the teaching-learning process of our students, the methodology used by the members of the commission of the project will be based on the experience and direct observation to promote a critical spirit.6. Results and long term benefitsThroughout the project the following documentation will be issued:- Europass Mobility Documents- Certificates of participation in mobilities- Training diplomas issued by an authorized centre by the European Commission- Individual Plans for the broadcasting of mobility activities- CV Europass- Europass Language PassportExpected long term benefits:-To obtain a global and diverse vision of the European educational system-To motivate the faculty to continuous training and mobility-To revise and update our School Plan to increase the quality of the teaching-learning process-To promote the desire  to investigate, to use ICT and foreign languages in a real and meaningful context and to develop abilities of creative thinking, personal growth and strategies7. ProfileSuitable candidates for each of the mobilities of the project are selected through a transparent and equanime process. The criteria of this selection is detailed in Section F of this project.

Harviala school is a medium-sized Finnish primary school with a total of 120 pupils aged 7-12. Our school is located in Janakkala municipality, close to the city of Hämeenlinna. A nursery school operates in the same premises with the school, nevertheless as an administratively separate unit. Since 2010 our school has run a co-operation program with the pre-school group to make the transition pois from pre-school to primary school as easy as possible. The pupils in pre-school, 1st and 2nd grades are taught environment and nature studies in workshops using mainly co-operative learning and the pupils are divided according to their individual learning styles. The teachers involved in this program work tightly together as a team in planning and teaching the lessons.The results have been very positive and due to them, the cooperation program of co-teaching environment and nature studies cross-curricularly and putting different age groups together in one teaching group will be widened to concern the upper grades in our school, too. For the transition in the teaching method it would be essential for our teachers to visit other European schools and see how team teacing, co-teaching and teaching environment and nature studies as a subject itself is implemented. This would be the first main focusing point of our project. We have planned two job-shadowing periods in two European schools and the idea is that each teacher in our school will attend a 5-day job-shadowing period in either of these schools and learn new procedures, ways of teaching, positive attitudes towards teamwork and of course positive attitudes towards international co-operation. 



The second main focus is ICT. ICT skills are used in every subject at school and both teachers and pupils need to learn vital digital skills. To be able to teach our pupils safe and varied uses of ICT, the teachers need constantly to be trained to be familiar with the new possibilities. Social media and its devices are strongly present at people's everyday life. Smartphones and tablets with cloud services offer endless possibilities also for educational purposes. How to effectively use the social media, cloud services, tablets, smart phones and for example a learning database in teaching, will be the areas in which we would like to improve our teachers' skills in the future. Being able to use the assistive technologies and special applications for tablets and smartphones will also give us another mean to differentiate, help and support pupils with learning difficulties. The planned action in this project will be two separate courses aimed at the teaching staff to improve their skills at using tablets and the educational applications available, and moreover, to learn to make our own applications which we can use specifically for the benefit of our pupils. The courses are arranged in Belgium and Austia and four members of our teaching staff will attend these 5-day courses. The teachers will be selected mainly based on their motivation and need for improving their professional skills.

As the third "silent" focus in this project we see internationalization. Our school has been actively involved with Comenius cooperation since 2000 and we are proud of  that. Working on different Comenius projects have brought Europe closer to our staff and pupils, made them more aware, and at the same time also curious, about other European countries and cultures and, most importantly, dispelled a lot of prejudices agains different cultures. Making new contacts and being able to discuss with European colleagues face-to face in this project will evolve new ideas for further cooperation in the future. 

The planned co-teaching project in our school will be carried our in any case in the near future and we think that this European mobility project will help our teachers to adjust to the idea of cooperation and teacmwork. The impacts of job-shadowing activites will be shown in the teachers' everyday work,  opening positive attitudes towards teamwork, co-teaching possibilites, and positive attitudes towards European co-operation. The planned courses for our staff will improve the teachers' ICT skills and by learning from each other we will gain another mean to differentiate and thus motivate our pupils. Skills in using tablets and social media and their educational applications in a safe, effective way will benefit our school for a long time, no matter what subject is concerned.
